sense.name: a device for gripping or for holding on to
sense.examples: The cloth handbag had an attractive bamboo grab. Leather grabs hung from the ceiling of the bus for passengers to hold.

sense.name: the act of physically clutching or snatching suddenly
sense.examples: The boy made a grab for the horse's reins before it bolted. The man made a grab for the pistol during the tussle. A grab of a muffin and a cup of coffee is John's usual breakfast.

sense.name: an unscrupulous acquisition of some asset
sense.examples: They exploited a technical point of law to effect a land grab. The corporate raider's grab of several companies in hostile takeovers has rocked the industry.

sense.name: a digitized still image from a video
sense.examples: John displayed a screen grab from Wednesday's program.

sense.name: something available for the taking
sense.examples: Several of the prizes are still up for grabs. Mary says these boxes of old clothing and books are up for grabs.
